content.description: It begins on the left-facing crack and ascends straight up to the mini roof. From there either top out left or right. Both seem about the same grade but the left seems a bit safer. Either way you don't want to fall as it may be your last with the boulder behind you becoming best friends with your noggin.
content.protection: Pads..but they only help so much with this climb.
content.location: Climber's left of 'Out To Lunch' by about 12 feet.

content.description: Stand start in the thin canyon on the right most section of the slab just under a flat jug. Climb up small slab features (with a fun step through, or hand foot match) to a huge ledge while avoiding the right arête. Topping out by crawling across the ledge to the right and scrambling up, which is the intended line. Feel free to traverse left at the ledge or downclimb instead.
content.protection: Two pads and maybe a spotter. Tall
content.location: While facing the main Romulus and Remus boulder (with Colorful Corner being the right arête), this climb goes up the slab in the canyon to the right of the arête.

content.description:
Start on a good ledge. Make your way through more good horizontal ledges and make a long move to the top. Finish matched on the ledge between the roof and the tree.

This route is #3a on Boulder 1: Romulus and Remus Face in the Romulus and Remus Area in the Brayack and Keenan Falcon guidebook.
content.protection: Highball and landing can be bad. Matching the top and down climb can be sketchy because it’s a long move and the top isn’t clean.
content.location: The start to this problem is just left of a rotting stump and goes up the line just right of the roof.

content.description: Start under the roof in front of some talus and climb past edges and horizontals to a flake. Make a move off of the flake to a horizontal under the roof. Downclimb the route to get down.
content.location: Under the right side of the roof to the right of "Remus" and to the left of "Colorful Corner".

content.description: Climb up to a ledge and then continue up a vertical crack to the top, utilizing pinches, jugs, and jams.
content.protection: Trad or top rope on natural anchor
content.location: Middle of boulder #2 in Romulus & Remus area in Brayak & Keenan guidebook. With your back to Romulus & Remus wall, the right hand block forming an alleyway leading downhill.

content.description: Start under the left side of the roof on a horizontal and make a long move to an edge. Continue past horizontals, a sidepull, and a pocket to finish on a jug under the roof. To get down, make a delicate traverse left to an easier downclimb.
content.location: Under the left side of the roof to the left of "Romulus" and "Colorful Corner".

content.description: Starts on opposing credit card crimps. Make a few moves straight up past slightly more forgiving crimps to a sidepull and thank-god ledge. Make your way up and left past the plant growing out of the rock.  Bonus points for not using it to top out.  Pretty hard for a V2 but its still fun!
content.location: Just beside the face on the boulder opposite of the Colorful Corner boulder. See picture (colorful corner in the background)

content.description:
Start on a good ledge. Move up through another good ledge to a horizontal. Make a long move to the end of the main block (horizontal ledge) and match.

This route is #2 on Boulder 2: Romulus and Remus Face in the Romulus and Remus Area in the Brayack and Keenan Falcon guidebook.
content.location: Start is 9 feet left of the arete and right in front of the talus that comes to a point right of the rotting stump. Climb trends slightly right so unless you do something silly you shouldn’t land on that talus.

content.description: Start at the obvious right facing flake in the middle of the large slab and walk your way up with the assistance of large holds.
content.protection: Top rope anchored to trees at the top; access on backside
content.location: Large mossy slab opposite the Romulus & Remus wall, forming an alleyway with the face with Out To Lunch and Apes Don't Tape

content.description: Climb the blunt arete of the large mossy slab on good holds and slopers, finding good foot placements hidden in the carpet of moss around the arete.
content.protection: Top rope from natural anchors on top of the boulder; access on backside
content.location: Blunt arete on the near side of the large mossy slab opposite the Romulus & Remus wall, forming an alleyway with the face with Out To Lunch and Apes Don't Tape

content.description: A fantastic arete climb! Start on a large edge and climb through a few very thin edges and sidepulls to a jug. Continue on good face holds to a scary but straightforward top out.
content.location: The obvious orange arete in the Romulus and Remus Area.
